title: Make the user-provided hero image visible in the app

requirements.text: Add the user-uploaded image (image-3.png) to the app as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated, and update the Home page hero banner to render this exact image so it is visible on the deployed site.

quotes: i want this image which i cannot find in the app

acceptanceCriteria: The hero banner image on the Home page renders the user-provided image (no broken image / fallback behavior triggered).
The hero banner image URL returns HTTP 200 in the deployed build and is accessible at a stable path under /assets/generated/.
No console warning appears about the hero image failing to load (i.e., Hero.tsx onError is not triggered under normal load).

requirements.text: Update the HTML preload tag to preload the new hero banner image path (replacing the current preload of /assets/generated/image-2.png) so the correct image is prioritized on first paint.

quotes: i want this image which i cannot find in the app

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html preloads the same hero image asset that Hero.tsx renders.
The app no longer references /assets/generated/image-2.png for the hero banner (unless used elsewhere intentionally).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose with them only).
Do not edit immutable hook paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
nonGoals: No changes to Internet Identity authentication, admin access control, or dashboard functionality.
No redesign of the overall site layout beyond swapping the hero banner image asset and its preload reference.

required: User-provided GB Insurance promotional vehicle montage image (gb-hero-banner.dim_1600x900.png)
